result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin C. Ferguson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Justin C. Ferguson
Current: 5915 17th Ave, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States  (Effective: 08-03-2016)
Prior: 5018 46th Ave, Kenosha, WI 53144 United States
Amended

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Xavier Solis.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Amended Information filed charging Possession of THC as a repeater (a misdemeanor).  Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Fined $100 + costs, 30 days to pay, or 10 days in Co. Jail.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge; written notice provided to defendant.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Justin C. Ferguson, appeared with Attorney Christine Lambrechts specially for Attorney Xavier Solis.  Clerk: PT
Case is not resolved at this time and Atty Binger requests a motion date be set on his other act motion as well as his motions in limine.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 1, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Justin C. Ferguson, appeared with Attorney Uzowulu specially for Attorney Xavier Solis.  Clerk: PT
Atty Uzowulu states they received a new offer and DE needs time to consider the offer.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 10:20 am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Attorney Xavier Solis appeared on behalf of Defendant Justin C. Ferguson who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
No appearance by the Defendant.  Court authorizes a Bench Warrant with a $5000 Cash Bond and prior bond shall be forfeited.

Defendant is now present in court and with his attorney who is appearing by phone.  DE states he thought he had court at 10:00.  Court vacates bench warrant and bond is reinstated.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:50 pm.
Atty X Solis.
At the request of Atty Solis and with no objection by ADA Binger, status conf. on 2/18/16 at 9:10 changed to 3/9/16 at 9:10.
Appearance Notice signed by defendant for hearing on 2/18/16 at 9:10.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Hertz-McGrath renews her motion to withdraw as counsel for the reasons stated on the record.  Court grants motion to withdraw as counsel.  Public Defender to appoint another attorney to represent the defendant.  Status conf. 2/18/16 at 9:10.  Bond continued.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Hertz-McGrath's motion to withdraw as counsel heard.  Def. asks that Atty Hertz-McGrath stay on the case as his attorney and he agrees to cooperate and keep all appointments.  Motion to withdraw held in abeyance until next hearing date.  Motion re other acts evidence 1/28/16 at 10:00.  Bond continued.
Atty Hertz-McGrath is out sick today.  Motion hearing (re motion to withdraw as counsel) reset for 12/11/15 at 8:40.

Case is not resolved at this time.  Parties are instructed to submit a letter or email to the court regarding status for trial in place of a jury status.  Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin C. Ferguson appeared with Attorney Denise s Hertz-Mcgrath.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens.
